item.title: Physics - Mechanics
item.description:
Motion

Relationship of force, mass, motion, energy, momentum…

Conserved quantities: Conservation <=> symmetries

  • Standardize on one object -> unit

    • conservation of units: multiply by 1 e.g. $1 y \times \frac{365days}{1year} \times \frac{24hrs}{1day} …$

  • Units are your friend! - Help you check mistakes & approx.

    • [d] = m, meter: how far light travel by $\frac{1}{?}$
    • [m] = kg, kilogram: $1.4755214 \times 10^{40} \cdot h \cdot \frac{f_{133cs}}{c^2}$

The radium ($\theta$) has no unit!

  • $10^n$: T: 1e12, G: 1e9, M: 1e6, K: 1e3, m: 1e-3, $\mu$: 1e-6, n: 1e-9, p: 1e-12, f: 1e-15

  • Fermi Problem: How many piano tuners are in Chicago?

Kinematics - consistent description of motion

  • scalar

  • vector: a basis is a set of vectors from which you can build any vector, and all basis vectors are needed. (1 block north + 1 block west in Manhattan)

    • Basis
      • orthonormal basis: ortho- - orthogonal: perpendicular; normal - length 1
      • $\vec{v}$: vector; $\hat{v}$: vector with length 1 ($\frac{\vec{v}}{|\vec{v}|}$)(unitless)
    • Product

      • dot product: $\vec{u} \cdot \vec{v} = |\vec{u}||\vec{v}|cos\theta = u_x v_x + u_y v_y + u_z v_z$

        • $\vec{u}$ with new basis: $\vec{u} = \vec{u} \cdot \hat{e_1} \hat{e_1}+ \vec{u} \cdot \hat{e_2} \hat{e_2} + \vec{u} \cdot \hat{e_3} \hat{e_3}$
        • Project of A: $|\vec{A}| cos \theta = \frac{\vec{A} \cdot \vec{B}}{|\vec{B}|}$

      • cross product: $\vec{u} \times \vec{v} = \hat{x}(u_y v_z - u_z v_y) + \hat{y}(u_z v_x - u_x v_z) + \hat{z}(u_x v_y - u_y v_x)$

        Direction: Left-hand fold rule

        1. point hand in dir of u
        2. sweep hand to dir v
        3. thumb points in $\vec{u} \times \vec{v}$

  • derivative

    • $\frac{dy}{dx}$ or y’(x)
    • $\dot{y}, \ddot{y}$: (second) derivative of time

  • integral

Polar Coordinates

  • Describe Vector: $(r, \theta)$

Description

  • position

    • position - location relative to a fixed point (origin) - Coordinate System: x-y, x-t

    • distance (scalar) - how far an object has traveled

    • displacement $\Delta{\vec{r}} = \vec{r}_f - \vec{r}_i$ (vector) - how far is an object from its original position

1D - x, others - $\vec{r}$

  • velocity

    • speed $v$ (scalar) - describes how fast a particle is moving

    • velocity $\vec{v}$ (vector) - speed in a given direction

      $$ secant: v_{av} = \frac{x_f - x_i}{t_f - t_i} \ tangent: v_{ins} = \frac{dx}{dt} $$

  • acceleration

    $$ \vec{a}_{inst} = \frac{d\vec{v}}{dt} = \frac{d^2\vec{r}}{dt^2} $$

  • RELATION: $x(t) = \frac{1}{2}at^2 + v_0t + x_0$ & $\Delta{x^2} = 2a\Delta{x}$, Core Formula for Circular Motion: $|a| = \frac{|v|^2}{R}$

  • Circular: if $|\vec{r}| = Constant$ then $\vec{r} \perp \vec{v}$; if $\vec{v} = Constant$ then $\vec{a} \perp \vec{v}$ ($\vec{w}$ is constant $\rArr \vec{w} \cdot \vec{v} = 0$)

  • Ballistic: $\frac{d\vec{v}}{dt} = -g\hat{z}, \frac{dv_z}{dt} = -g$ -> $x = \frac{v_0^2}{g}\sin2\theta$

Dynamics - Causes of motion + changes

N2L: $\vec{a} = \frac{\vec{F}}{m}$ or $\vec{F}_{TOT} = \sum\vec{F} = m \vec{a}$

N1L: $\vec{F} \rArr \frac{d\vec{v}}{dt} = 0$

  • Mass $m$

    • Inertial ($E = mc$) mass: $m = \frac{\vec{F}}{\vec{a}}$
    • Gravitational mass: $m = \frac{\vec{F}}{-g\vec{z}}$

  • Force $\vec{F}$: With FBD (Free Body Diagram)

    • Normal (perpendicular) Force: Perpendicular to surface, connectors force perpendicular to the surface
    • Friction Force: “proportional” to normal force & opposes applied force or motion
      • Static: max static friction - $- \mu_s F_N$
      • Kinetic: $- \mu_k F_N \hat{v}$

      $\mu_k < \mu_s$

N3L: $\vec{F}{a-b} = -\vec{F}{b-a}$

  • Integration & Separation

Energy

Integral Required

Work $W (N \cdot m) = \int{\vec{F} \cdot d\vec{r}}$

Kinetic Energy $K_{\epsilon} = \frac{1}{2}mv^2$

$$ \vec{F} = m \cdot \vec{a} = m \cdot \frac{d\vec{v}}{dt}, d\vec{r}(v) = t \cdot d\vec{v} $$ $$ W = \int{m \cdot \frac{d\vec{v}}{dt} \cdot d\vec{r}} = \int{m \cdot \frac{d\vec{v}(t(v))}{dt(v)} \cdot t(v) \cdot d\vec{v}} = \frac{1}{2}mv^2 $$
